intro: Pentaphalangium volkensii, commonly known as the Volkens' milkweed, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have a white or pale pink color. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family.
